numerics.hyperbolics
Class gamma

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--numerics.hyperbolics.gamma
public final class gamma
extends java.lang.Object

Overview
The gamma class provides a the function gamma_function which can calculate the mathematical function gamma(X) for real arguments of X. This function is a java port of the gamma function developed for the C programming language by the Risoe National Laboratory. The C code was orginally written in fortran and subsequently ported. The Java function gamma_function was compared with the Mathematica 4.0 gamma function and provided excellent agreement for all positive values and for negative values that were not near a negative integer. When the gamma_function argument is near (less than 0.01 away) a negative integer the Java gamma function does not correspond well with Mathematica because the function approaches complex infinity. This C port of the gamma function was provided by Peter Kirkegaard at peter.kirkegaard@risoe.dk.

Class verification and debugging technique: The gamma function was tested for a range of values between -19 and +20 with an increment of 0.3. The function was also tested with a narrow range of values from -19.5 to -18.5 with an increment of 0.1. These values were compared to Mathematica gamma function evaluations and were found to be nearly identical. The results did diverge slightly near negative whole numbers were the gamma function approaches complex infinity. The output from the functions are presented at the bottom of java source file.

ACTION AND REVISION LOG 

 Author         Date        Action
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 RISOE NL       09-01-95  RISOE Computer Laboratory Created C++ gamma port
 Tony Held(TH)  01-19-00  Function received from RISOE
 TH             01-19-00  Gamma function results compared favorably for C++ port
 TH             08-09-00  Function ported to Java Class
 TH             08-12-00  Class commented and gamma function results compared favorably with Mathematica


JAVA Port Notes
Given that the original code was in C++ a few minor changes had to be made to the gamma function
1. long and short integer types were replaced with long and int
2. Initialization arrays bounds were removed for P, Q, & C
3. Array indexes were cast to int from long
4. Math functions were prefixed with Math
5. Statement with an implicit cast to boolean were made explicit
6. N was cast to long explicitly in line with the statement (N = Y - 1.0)
7. A Java function modf was created by TH to similate the c++ function modf

ORIGINAL COMMENTS FROM THE RISOE LABORATORY C FILE 
 C ------------------------------ gamma.c -------------------------------
 C ***********           RISOE NATIONAL LABORATORY            ***********
 C ***********       RISOE COMPUTER LIBRARY     OCT 1995      ***********
 C ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 C PURPOSE
 C     RETURNS THE FUNCTION GAMMA(X) FOR A REAL ARGUMENT X.
 C
 C METHOD
 C     THE PRESENT ROUTINE IS BASED ON THE CORRESPONDING ROUTINE IN
 C     'SPECFUN' (1). RATIONAL APPROXIMATIONS ARE USED (2),(3).
 C
 C REFERENCES
 C     (1) W.J.CODY, SPECFUN - A PORTABLE SPECIAL FUNCTION PACKAGE,
 C         NEW COMPUTING ENVIRONMENTS: MICROCOMPUTERS IN LARGE-SCALE
 C         SCIENTIFIC COMPUTING (A.WOUK, ED.), SIAM, PHILADELPHIA,
 C         (1987) PP 1-12.
 C     (2) W.J.CODY, AN OVERVIEW OF SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT FOR SPECIAL
 C         FUNCTIONS, LECTURE NOTES IN MATHEMATICS, 506, NUMERICAL
 C         ANALYSIS DUNDEE (1975), G.A.WATSON (ED.), SPRINGER VERLAG,
 C         BERLIN (1976).
 C     (3) HART ET AL., COMPUTER APPROXIMATIONS. WILEY & SONS, N.Y.(1968)
 C
 C *********** E N D  O F  D E S C R I P T I O N  F I E L D *************

Constructor Detail

gamma

public gamma()
Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
main is only used to verify that the gamma function results are similar to standard mathematical routines such as Mathematica. The gamma.main method will output gamma function values for a range of values defined by 3 arguments. The 3 arguments will be converted from string to type double.
usage: java numerics.hyperbolics.gamma LowerBound UpperBound Increment
example: java numerics.hyperbolics.gamma -19 20 .5
Parameters:
LowerBound - Lower bound of the range of variables to be called with the gamma function.
UpperBound - Upper bound of the range of variables to be called with the gamma function.
Increment - Increment between LowerBound and UpperBound.

gamma_function

public static final double gamma_function(double X)
gamma_function returns the mathematical function gamma(X) for a real number X.
Parameters:
X - is a real number.
Returns:
The numerical approximation of gamma(X).

modf

protected static double modf(double dblRealNum)
The modf method is a simple interpretation of the C++ function modf which returns the signed integer part of a real number.

Example:
    double x, y;
    x = -14.87654321;
    y= modf(x);
    Result:
    x= -14.876543, y=-14
Parameters:
dblRealNum - a double that will have the fractional part trucated leaving only a signed double value similar to an integer.
Returns:
a double value representing the signed integer of dblRealNum
